stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on refining Return to Yoshi's Island: he demonstrated recent performance/bug fixes, added an anti-alias toggle, and live-designed the new icy fortress (Course 13) while testing everything on real N64 hardware.  He also reacted to the F3 fangame showcase and discussed future release and legal considerations.

development_findings.summary: A week of bug-fixing and micro-optimisations has almost cleared Kaze’s performance to-do list, noticeably boosting framerate on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: Over the last week or so, I did a lot of bug fixing… I almost finished my to-do list regarding bugs and performance issues.

development_findings.summary: An in-game option now toggles anti-aliasing; it runs on real consoles and lets players choose between sharp or smooth visuals.
development_findings.quote: When you want anti-aliasing, there you go. Now the game is anti-aliased.

development_findings.summary: The long-broken warp pipe now works on N64 after a recent fix, confirming stable warp behaviour on hardware.
development_findings.quote: There's a pipe here that never worked on N64… It works!

development_findings.summary: Course 13 level design: Kaze refined the slide → snowman path, squared wall-kick angles, lengthened the run-up for a triple-jump, and judged difficulty as ‘just right’.
development_findings.quote: The wall kicks are otherwise a bit awkward… I'm going to give the player a little bit of a longer walk up so that they feel comfortable triple jumping.

development_findings.summary: Course 13’s oversized geometry breaks the Mario 64 camera; Kaze will either shrink the space or devise a new camera solution.
development_findings.quote: I think this level is a little too big and that's why the camera does this… I might have to invent a solution to that problem.

development_findings.summary: A treasure room will end Course 13; because the hack has no 100-coin star, back-tracking is intentionally blocked.
development_findings.quote: Then behind it I want there to be a huge treasure room… You also can't go back to the main level from here… there's no 100 coin stars.

development_findings.summary: Bunny Brush (Course 1) now renders with infinite draw distance on N64 yet still reaches ~60 FPS, proving the new renderer’s efficiency.
development_findings.quote: This level has infinite drawing distance even on 64… it's still at 60 FPS sometimes.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s redesigned ‘fuzzy’ enemies wear protective gear, improving readability and humour.
development_findings.quote: This was Biobak's idea and Biobak made the model. They're now wearing protective gear.

development_findings.summary: New music tracks exist for the Bowser office and elevator but are not yet hooked up in the game.
development_findings.quote: We have a song for the Bowser office and the Bowser elevator now.

development_findings.summary: After Course 13, only two levels remain; Kaze wants this course finished within a month, keeping ROM size under 64 MB.
development_findings.quote: I hope I can finish this level in the next month or so and then it's just two levels missing.

development_findings.summary: One-button deployment plus a capture-card lets Kaze test every build instantly on real N64 hardware, shortening iteration time.
development_findings.quote: All I have to do to test this on the N64 is hit this button here… It's as shrimpless as that.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is monitoring OPUS/LibDragon compression so the full soundtrack might fit inside the 64 MB ROM limit.
development_findings.quote: I still hope that one day OPUS compression… so we can just put a whole hack OST on it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze became a father five days ago; daughter Reyna is upstairs with Zeina’s mother, which currently limits his fatigue and workload.
context_findings.quote: Yes, the baby came out five days ago… She is currently upstairs with Zeina's mom.

context_findings.summary: He joked that he is ‘more proud’ of a new level than of his child, illustrating his intense artistic focus.
context_findings.quote: Somehow I'm more proud of this than of the child. What can I say? I'm an artist.

context_findings.summary: Kaze believes ROM hacks can afford greater creativity than commercial games because they do not need to sell.
context_findings.quote: ROM hack can get a little more creative… when you have to sell well, you have to make something somewhat bland.

context_findings.summary: His art philosophy rejects rule-based ‘principles’ in favour of designing for a target emotion or experience.
context_findings.quote: Think about what feeling do I want to create… If you operate on principles, you make art for critics.

context_findings.summary: He views Nintendo C&D fears as exaggerated; most fangames can release openly or leak anonymously.
context_findings.quote: You won't get C&D'd most likely unless your game gets really, really popular… If you shut up about it, you C&D'd yourself.

context_findings.summary: Switching streams to YouTube caused a viewership drop, which he attributes to fans not realising the move.
context_findings.quote: There was a very big drop in viewers when I switched to YouTube… a lot of people just didn't know I switched.

biobak.summary: Created the new fuzzy enemy model with protective gear, which Kaze praised as a major visual improvement.
biobak.quote: This was Biobak's idea and Biobak made the model.

biobak.summary: Is expected to ‘rework Cooper Carnival’ later in development, adding extra polish.
biobak.quote: Is Biobak going to rework Cooper Carnival? I hope so. That is the plan anyway.

zeina.summary: Active in chat but off-camera caring for the newborn; Kaze notes she will likely appear on stream again after maternity recovery.
zeina.quote: She's always in chat… maybe if you ask her nicely she can come in for a second.

key_stories.title: Warp Pipe Resurrection
key_stories.summary: A long-broken warp pipe finally functions on original hardware.  The brief fix validated recent engine stability work and delighted Kaze on-stream.
key_stories.challenge: The pipe warp consistently failed on real N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Kaze tracked down the bug during his recent optimisation sprint and patched it before the stream.
key_stories.outcome: On stream he entered the pipe successfully, confirming the fix.
key_stories.key_quote: There's a pipe here that never worked on N64… It works!

key_stories.title: Taming Course 13’s Slide
key_stories.summary: While building the icy fortress, Kaze found the slide-to-snowman sequence awkward.  He repositioned platforms, reduced wall-kick angles, and lengthened the triple-jump runway until the flow felt right.
key_stories.challenge: Wall-kick section felt awkward and too difficult; camera also misbehaved due to map size.
key_stories.process: Iterative 3D modelling and in-engine tests, shrinking geometry and parallelising walls.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze declared the first section ‘works very well’; camera fix deferred to later.
key_stories.key_quote: The platforming in the first section worked… Works very well.

key_stories.title: Fuzzy Enemy Make-Over
key_stories.summary: Enemy fuzzies from an earlier level looked dated.  Biobak pitched a redesign, modelling them with safety helmets.  The refreshed enemies became a showcase clip during the stream.
key_stories.challenge: Old enemy model lacked charm and clarity.
key_stories.process: Biobak produced a new model; Kaze integrated and demoed it with lighting and music.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze praised the result and labelled it superior to Nintendo’s original.
key_stories.key_quote: These are a little better. This was Biobak's idea and Biobak made the model.

key_stories.title: Instant Hardware Testing Workflow
key_stories.summary: Kaze demonstrated a one-button pipeline that compiles, flashes, and captures gameplay on an actual Nintendo 64, eliminating traditional hardware iteration lag.
key_stories.challenge: Typical hardware testing is slow and discourages frequent checks.
key_stories.process: Set up automated build script plus EverDrive and capture card; mapped to a single IDE button.
key_stories.outcome: He can switch from PC to N64 in seconds, using it repeatedly during the stream.
key_stories.key_quote: All I have to do… hit this button… turn on my N64… It’s as shrimpless as that.
